document.title: South Carolina College- and Career-Ready English Language Arts Standards

7844C5740C964AFA96AD91266E26A012.description: Ask and answer questions in conversation on a topic.

AED9335DA1C240929840077F72753510.description: Evaluate and critique ideas and concepts interactively through listening and speaking.

11434E484B214072AF09DA5698DDD2E4.description: consider the ideas of others while engaging in conversations.

25F4899E96264EF09961A60F67F2877C.description: enter a conversation by greeting, taking turns, and responding to others with statements, phrases, and/or questions; and

867EF6A3CE344F3480BC627A24C6C2D7.description: Participate with peers and adults in structured discussions and routines about grade-appropriate topics and texts:

D7C7B06B5164446C9F8E9F0F0A267762.description: Through collaboration, react and respond to information while building upon the ideas of others and respecting diverse perspectives.

DF3A026E4B734CDC8EE70C08FC2E3AAA.description: Present information orally in a logical order of events using conjunctions and temporal words (e.g., before, after).

D776B39030C844BF9AFD83C05A3C6FF3.description: Organize and communicate ideas through a range of formats to engage a variety of audiences.

FD9EF9ED29E24B0A999F31FCC1C6EC75.description: Print all uppercase and lowercase letters, focusing on pencil grasp, letter formation, legibility, and pacing; use appropriate spacing for letters, words, and sentences.

73153E47BE43431CA0451FA39DC3393B.description: Write independently and legibly for a variety of tasks and purposes.

8C9F4DA61CD444B691792C727297BDB3.description: With guidance and support, plan, revise, edit, and build on personal ideas and the ideas of others to strengthen writing.

B63EDC007A814758A0CFF25F5986426D.description: Revise writing to improve clarity and enhance style appropriate to audience, purpose, and task.

84901CEDC51B4D1EB944231C17E055AA.description: identify and use simple and declarative sentences.

5A1C9BC3556E49738C3F7647F3869D6B.description: identify and use action verbs; and

94B2713650A34C85A5276276DAA91D16.description: identify and use common singular and plural nouns;

375EA8E8445C498D82C5DA09E9A1AECE.description: identify and use periods to punctuate sentences;

AB3A31B611154186AE4931FF7A1C3725.description: identify and name end punctuation marks (e.g., periods, exclamation points, and question marks);

4FD229B6DB4A4A4088FB806C1060E8E0.description: capitalize the first word in a sentence and the pronoun I;

513E9115B55E43E1BD36113AA308C7CC.description: Form and use complete simple sentences. When writing:

BE4E00867AA14C849BF892D44ED93C9B.description: Demonstrate command of standard English grammar and conventions when writing.

991DB3483B784282BB7A3BC04BCA2566.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to narrate a single event or linked events in a logical order.

FEDB2B25546E4100868BD839FF2D013A.description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences using effective techniques.

73E88E51F57347A8AFDAA5C56E2649C3.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose informative/explanatory pieces about a topic with supporting details.

922CD3D7250B49C1B40B1DC4650A667B.description: Write informative/expository texts to analyze and explain complex ideas and information.

D1C8E9A9723242C4924FC77BBE9983DA.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to state a topic and communicate an opinion and a supporting reason.

9C68F6A9DADB405B8245DA94C5109B61.description: Write arguments to support claims with clear reasons and relevant evidence.

3D26195071C6464B8483D22BFA3A662B.description: Instruction of this indicator begins in fourth grade.

6AC05269A74C408F9E292ADEAF9F2E51.description: Instruction of this indicator begins in fourth grade.

AC9C40D302D94CCD9DD66D66A4741076.description: Instruction of this indicator begins in fourth grade.

355EB2C451144EA99E45ED61D565EBF2.description: Instruction of this indicator begins in second grade.

9EF8DC633DD94CB8A50891DA71CF09A4.description: Ask and answer questions (who, what, when, where, why, and how) about print and non-print sources to obtain and refine knowledge.

C2E63BAD885B4448ADC8C0715509F80C.description: Use critical thinking skills to investigate, evaluate, and synthesize a variety of sources to obtain and refine knowledge.

6212C2DED8F44DCE9EADCA19A7534733.description: Describe the relationship between visuals (e.g., illustrations, photographs) and the text.

99B3220FBC444D9AA05D0D6522B63E73.description: Evaluate and critique multimedia presentations of a text or subject, including their impact on an audience.

1045BA63C94A43F0B8857D0E26855690.description: Use knowledge of morphemes to extract meaning from oral language in grade-appropriate content.

1E976AD626664082A943BA2A6E1C23A9.description: Build and apply a range of academic vocabulary, as well as grade-level appropriate morphology to apply to reading, writing, and speaking.

2D3C7C60F6E444198F08CEBF35BF276B.description: identify and explain descriptive words and phrases that suggest feelings or appeal to the senses.

0D2B86DC313441ED9B29063C74118EDF.description: deepen understanding of words by relating words to their opposites; and

126E2AD26A374F678EF42E829884D2F3.description: sort words and phrases into categories (e.g., apple, fruit and carrot, vegetable) to develop an understanding of word relationships;

B21F432EFD9548CCB801CC462FE7F438.description: Determine the effectiveness of an author's use of words and phrases in literary, informational, and multimedia texts:

06C464FDFC2A4BABB1607B4AC5BDA928.description: Analyze word relationships and nuances in word meanings within literary and informational texts.

A6B8804183CD4A11994EE5E3C1688374.description: use words and phrases acquired through conversations, being read to, and responding to texts.

CA8E893FE59F4362B7F3A8DF2BD9C76A.description: ask and answer questions about words and phrases to determine their meaning; and

F6ADC905960C4FF0800ABD08EB36225D.description: Determine the meaning of known and unknown words and phrases, choosing from an array of strategies:

31E6B1FFEDC54AC19D1D3F01BE185B13.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases.

82182E629377404DB64D76EDB565ABEF.description: include topic and supporting details for an informational text.

6E5F143BA7FA4ECBBA33E83B62D84647.description: include main character(s), setting, and important events for a story; and

63B1E555E75240F0BC0FB35736EE4E59.description: Retell a text orally to enhance comprehension:

998EC9E9048F4AEBB910F0AB02641DBA.description: Summarize and paraphrase text to support comprehension and understanding.

C4C8CD7FDBE64E8D81F3042CB4A3BDE7.description: Identify an author's opinion about a topic in an informational text.

3ACEC1991ABA4C4C9A0599D7B76F5772.description: Identify and use text features such as titles, headings, subheadings, illustrations, and/or photographs to predict and confirm the topic of informational texts.

EC11B67520E646A5BB619D382EA49E81.description: Identify and describe the basic characteristics of literary text to include narrative, drama, and poetry.

8CB2D9ACA76B45A8BA082155A728C27A.description: Evaluate and critique how an author uses words, phrases, and text structures to craft text.

9701F174C0C24C8C804349467B255E23.description: Identify and explain the roles of the author and the illustrator in an informational text.

3BCC1D4EB5B04F3CB90105FAB126BB53.description: Evaluate and critique how an author's perspective and purpose shape style and meaning within and across informational texts.

FC9C9FBC60C0472D851558833CC1CB59.description: Identify and explain the roles of the author and the illustrator of a story.

798A19CDD9474C86B3A964811F97CB30.description: Evaluate how an author's choice of point of view or perspective shapes style and meaning within and across literary texts.

21D470824F5C406380BBCD94D68BBDE0.description: Retell familiar texts by identifying the topic and supporting details in an informational text.

618AA96DB4CF427391EAFB535FA9BC40.description: Retell familiar stories using main story elements in a literary text.

AA8C5CCB1EE548AA92560D52ED8FD2B7.description: Evaluate and critique the development of themes and central ideas within and across texts.

2A03FA15DA6F46EC84B152903C570FE2.description: Identify forms of figurative language to include alliteration and onomatopoeia, as well as descriptive words and rhyme in text.

BB15677EB8A54B97A003431448CE6060.description: Identify and describe the main character(s), setting, and events that move the plot forward.

988608D802A741E483B97BDA9520D713.description: Evaluate and critique key literary elements that enhance and deepen meaning within and across texts.

7A385A0850574B8F90620124EE7CD096.description: using visuals from the text to support decoding and confirm recognition.

422394DFCCF147EB828A20FAB58466AC.description: decoding the word by analogy; and

57D2A932CB2D49259BEACB841BCFCD05.description: using letter-sound knowledge to segment and blend sounds together;

1D74C5BD38AA40F3B45C3F3D84F4EAD9.description: Read texts orally with accuracy and expression.

6FF123F41E144838A4299F91C1E4C32C.description: Read high-frequency words commonly found in grade-appropriate text with accuracy and automaticity.

006F232DE3E44EEEB18328633ADA448B.description: Read and reread grade-appropriate texts with accuracy and expression at an appropriate rate to support comprehension.

F698F191F10143FBBF4F42B5D0D3AEBB.description: consonant digraphs (ch, sh, th, wh); and

5F38B8D63C674DFB94B5C4EA3D809472.description: Use knowledge that every syllable must have a vowel sound to determine the number of syllables in words.

EABE7D39D2564529B6F89EB2C48374E1.description: Delete, add, and substitute the initial, middle, and end letters in CVC words to build or make new words.

13B3E82F772B4773BF69391E248D6CC4.description: Blend letter sounds to decode vowel-consonant (VC) and consonant-vowel-consonant (CVC) words in isolation and in text.

AB6505B6B6934A51A1E8B747F9CFE493.description: in a vowel- consonant-e (VCe) syllable with prompting and support.

6E04286056B14AE7B02BB7C0661F404D.description: in an open syllable (e.g. he, so, me, go, hi); and

2AB1B7A64E5A4C3BB06F4B537B8C00C6.description: in a closed syllable (VC: at; CVC: bat);

AE3865B6C2004AC4B76A7D32E2269084.description: Identify the vowel and produce the vowel sound in a printed syllable or word when decoding:

D9BDC95D6470405398623BC628F30739.description: Produce one-to-one letter-sound correspondences for each consonant with automaticity.

F00F8584622D4B52990F4C924B925DB5.description: Compare and contrast letters based on similarities and differences, including name, shape, sound, and approach strokes for writing.

05192313335B4355B7F8842E9B1BFA10.description: Identify, name, and form all upper and lowercase letters with automaticity.

94364E9E72C34B62A0576D418250966C.description: Know and apply phonics and word analysis skills in decoding and encoding words.

D472CFB15391414D83A399799569F6AA.description: Identify letters and words within sentences.

53A7DE86D99549479481F26E8FDFAB4E.description: Identify the beginning and end of a sentence by locating the capital letter and end punctuation.

8EDFC4008F75408780D4FD3DDFE2DEEF.description: Follow words from left to right, top to bottom by returning to the beginning of the next line, and page by page.

B706D1B7D99C4B1E91FBD801AAC0B291.description: Demonstrate one-to-one correspondence by pointing to words, noting that there are spaces between words.

2791BCCC3730491DADFADB902DC958E4.description: Locate a book's front cover, back cover, title page, and where to begin reading.

9D818115EDE94BB8995741058451BBD0.description: Demonstrate knowledge of the organization and basic concepts of print.

5C3A06044F284EBDB95CF352573D7F91.description: Delete, add, and substitute the initial or final phonemes of a spoken CVC word.

E2345120D1A8426CAB11C510B396630F.description: Orally identify initial, medial, and final phonemes in two- and three-phoneme (VC or CVC) words, excluding CVC words ending with /l/, /r/, or /x/.

53B7D25109D644589882BF0BBA4C2CE9.description: Blend and segment onsets and rimes of single syllable spoken words.

5C4D4872049F4452B52C107346243457.description: Count, segment, and blend phonemes in single syllable spoken words made up of three or four phonemes and compound words.

425E4EE8F0D1462F964C1EE518B7F950.description: Recognize and produce pairs of rhyming words and distinguish them from non-rhyming pairs using pictures and/or spoken words.

B05CF7AC82A3422ABABF54DA489BF885.description: Count the number of words in a spoken sentence.

02CCF44DEFF041A6B18D846BAAAB23F5.description: Demonstrate early phonological awareness to basic phonemic awareness in spoken words.

C527A4DB540A446CBD10CDF408C92E1C.description: Create quality work by adhering to an accepted format.

041CF0A8F85B43CD977576458905776C.description: Cite evidence to explain and justify reasoning.

CBA16478B52D43038C9C0C3E27477798.description: Collaborate with others and use active listening skills.

E48C0D7D826A412084D8989908F910F2.description: Acquire, refine, and share knowledge through a variety of multimedia literacies to include written, oral, visual, digital, and interactive texts.

817E48B932FB436685FA9973E6CBD04A.description: Read and write for a variety of purposes, including academic and personal, for extended periods of time.
